title: Bank of America Surveyed Fund Managers: What Will US Interest Rates Be in 2025? When is the Cut?
body: A recent Bank of America survey of global fund managers found that a majority of investors predict the Fed will cut interest rates in 2025. According to the survey conducted in February, 77% of fund managers expect a rate cut, while 46% predict two cuts, 27% one cut and 4% three cuts. Meanwhile, 19% of respondents believe interest rates will remain unchanged, while only 1% predict a rate hike. The rate cut expectations come amid ongoing inflationary pressures. January inflation figures that beat estimates led to a sharp decline in stock markets and a rise in borrowing costs. These market moves reflect concerns that the Fed could keep rates high for longer than previously expected. Related News: High Volatility Dominates Bitcoin Price: Analytics Firm Identifies Key Levels to Maintain and Exceed Bill Adams, chief economist at Comerica Bank, said the latest inflation data supports the view that underlying price pressures remain a problem. “The Fed will view the January high inflation data as confirmation that price pressures continue to bubble beneath the surface of the economy,” Adams said in a note to clients. “This would reinforce the Fed’s intention to at least slow and possibly even end rate cuts in 2025.” RSM US chief economist Joseph Brusuelas shared a similar view, revising his forecast to a single rate cut in December. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Bank of America Surveyed Fund Managers: What Will US Interest Rates Be in 2025? When is the Cut?

title: EUR/JPY Surges to 159.00: Market Optimism Boosts Euro Against Yen
body: Exciting developments in the Forex market today! The EUR/JPY pair is making waves, surging towards the 159.00 mark. What’s fueling this impressive climb? It’s all about market optimism and how global economic factors are influencing currency valuations. Let’s dive into the details of why the Euro is gaining ground against the Japanese Yen and what could potentially shape its future trajectory. Decoding the EUR/JPY Surge: Market Optimism Takes Center Stage The EUR/JPY pair’s recent ascent is primarily attributed to a boost in market optimism . This positive sentiment stems from the welcome news of a postponement in former US President Donald Trump’s proposed reciprocal tariffs. This development has eased concerns about immediate trade tensions, leading to a depreciation of the safe-haven Japanese Yen (JPY) and consequently, a stronger Euro (EUR) in the pair. Here’s a breakdown of the key factors driving this movement: Trump Tariff Delay: The postponement of tariffs has calmed market anxieties, reducing the appeal of safe-haven currencies like the JPY. JPY Weakness: As risk appetite increases due to reduced trade war fears, the Japanese Yen naturally weakens, benefiting pairs like EUR/JPY. Euro Strength (Relative): While the Eurozone faces its own economic challenges, in this specific scenario, it is comparatively stronger against the weakening Yen. Will Bank of Japan Hawkishness Curb EUR/JPY Gains? While market optimism is currently pushing EUR/JPY higher, the path ahead isn’t without potential obstacles. A significant factor that could temper the pair’s upward momentum is the rising hawkish sentiment surrounding the Bank of Japan (BOJ) . Consider these points regarding the BOJ’s influence: Strong GDP Data: Japan’s unexpectedly robust Gross Domestic Product (GDP) report has fueled speculation about a potential shift in the BOJ’s ultra-loose monetary policy. Rate Hike Expectations: Markets are now pricing in a considerable rate increase by the BOJ in 2025, indicated by the rising yields on Japanese government bonds. JPY Support: Increased hawkishness from the BOJ could provide substantial support to the Japanese Yen, potentially limiting further gains for EUR/JPY and even triggering a reversal. The increasing probability of BOJ rate hikes can be visualized in the following table representing market expectations: Indicator Current Market Pricing BOJ Rate Hikes in 2025 37 basis points 10-year JGB Yield Highest since April 2010 ECB Rate Cut Outlook: A Headwind for the Euro? On the other side of the EUR/JPY equation, the Euro faces its own set of pressures. Despite the current market optimism driven rally, the European Central Bank (ECB)’s stance on future monetary policy could act as a headwind. Several ECB officials have expressed confidence in the outlook for further ECB rate cuts this year. Here’s what’s weighing on the Euro from the ECB’s perspective: Planned Rate Cuts: ECB officials are signaling at least three more rate cuts in the pipeline following a recent 25 basis point reduction. Divergence with BOJ: The contrast between potential ECB rate cuts and BOJ rate hikes creates a divergence in monetary policy, which can weaken the Euro against the Yen. Economic Challenges: The Eurozone’s economic outlook remains uncertain, justifying the ECB’s dovish stance and potential rate cuts. Geopolitical Wildcard: Ukraine Ceasefire and Euro Gains Amidst these economic factors, a significant geopolitical event could dramatically alter the EUR/JPY landscape. A potential ceasefire in Ukraine and the resumption of gas supplies to Europe could provide a substantial boost to the Euro. Consider this potential game-changer: Ukraine Peace Talks: Reports suggest that US and Russian presidents have agreed to initiate negotiations, with officials meeting in Saudi Arabia. Euro Upside Potential: JP Morgan analysts suggest that a ceasefire could lead to a 5% appreciation in the EUR/USD pair, indicating significant Euro strength. Energy Security: Resumed gas supplies would alleviate energy concerns in Europe, bolstering economic confidence and the Euro. Interest Rates and Currency Dynamics: A Quick Recap To understand the broader context of EUR/JPY movements, it’s crucial to grasp the fundamentals of interest rates and their impact on currencies. How do Interest Rates Influence Currencies? Higher interest rates generally attract global investors, making a country’s currency more appealing and strengthening its value. Central banks use interest rates as a tool to manage inflation and stimulate or cool down the economy. For example, if a central bank raises interest rates to combat inflation, it can lead to increased demand for that country’s currency. Interest Rates and Gold Prices Conversely, higher interest rates can negatively impact gold prices. This is because higher rates increase the opportunity cost of holding gold, which doesn’t yield interest, compared to interest-bearing assets or cash in the bank. Furthermore, higher US interest rates often strengthen the US Dollar, and since gold is priced in USD, a stronger dollar can push gold prices down. The Fed Funds Rate Explained The Fed Funds rate, set by the US Federal Reserve, is a key benchmark in global finance. It’s the overnight rate at which US banks lend to each other. Market expectations for future Fed Funds rate movements, tracked by tools like the CME FedWatch, heavily influence financial market behavior as traders anticipate future monetary policy decisions. Conclusion: Navigating the EUR/JPY Landscape Amidst Optimism and Uncertainty The EUR/JPY pair’s current surge reflects a wave of market optimism , primarily driven by the easing of trade war anxieties. However, this upward trend faces significant counterwinds. The potential for increased hawkishness from the Bank of Japan , contrasted with the ECB’s rate cut outlook, creates a complex and potentially volatile scenario. Geopolitical developments, particularly concerning Ukraine, add another layer of uncertainty and opportunity. Traders should closely monitor these factors to navigate the EUR/JPY landscape effectively. While market optimism is a powerful force, fundamental economic and geopolitical factors will ultimately determine the pair’s long-term direction. To learn more about the latest Forex market trends, explore our articles on key developments shaping currency valuations and global economic events.

title: Hong Kong grants license to Bullish, bringing total licensed crypto exchanges to 10
body: The Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission has granted Bullish, a crypto trading platform, a license to operate within its territory. This brings the total number of licensed crypto exchange platforms in Hong Kong to 10. Bullish senior vice president Michael Lau, who also serves as head of global sales, stressed that Hong Kong is an integral business hub. Lau further stated that Bullish has more than 100 staff in Hong Kong. After getting the license, Bullish’s strategy in Hong Kong will focus on institutional business. Bullish gets approval as Consensus goes to Hong Kong for the first time Bullish recently acquired CoinsDesk, an extensive media, events, and index platform that organizes the crypto industry’s major forum, Consensus. For the first time, the Consensus event is taking place on a full scale outside the US. The event has already kicked off and will continue at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre until February 20th. Today, February 19th is the highlight of the event, which is expected to draw approximately 8,000 people. Michael Lau, chairman of Consensus Hong Kong, stressed that the decision to hold Consensus was strategic. In a joint interview with Leung at the offices of InvestHK on February 13, Lau said: “Choosing Hong Kong was a pretty strategic decision because we know that one of the big themes within the whole space is … this technology has enabled [that] traditional finance.” Michael Lau Hong Kong has been keen to highlight its continued support for the virtual asset sector as it showcases its ability and capacity to host major industry events. Currently, stablecoins, which are typically pegged to traditional currencies like the US dollar, are a major topic in the crypto world. Many in the crypto community believe stablecoins have more applications within traditional finance than other cryptocurrencies. Hong Kong is developing stablecoin regulations that the Hong Kong Monetary Authority will oversee. More platforms are in the queue of the SFC for approvals to operate in Hong Kong Hong Kong’s commitment to enabling a digital asset economy is evident in its regulatory framework, which includes licensing approved firms that have completed the necessary legal procedures. Currently, eight platforms for virtual asset trading are waiting for approval from the Securities and Futures Commission ( SFC). According to Mr. Yip Chi Hang, the executive director of the SFC’s intermediaries division, the market is becoming explicit about the regulatory body’s licensing standards. He said that licenses will be issued again. However, only applicants who meet the required standards will obtain the licenses. The Consensus event is taking place two months after CoinDesk’s newsroom was marred by controversy over the firing of editors over a story about Tron founder Justin Sun. The article satirically explained Sun’s public eating of a banana that was part of the conceptual artwork Comedian , which the crypto entrepreneur bought for $6.2 million. Hong Kong is shaping its ambitions to become a crypto hub Hong Kong first outlined a plan to become a virtual asset hub in 2022, following Beijing’s sweeping ban on all crypto transactions in mainland China the previous year. Since then, it has launched the first spot crypto exchange-traded funds in Asia and other initiatives. Hong Kong’s Cyberport Web3 network, a state-run business hub promoting digital asset innovation, now features over 270 blockchain firms, having added more than 120 in the past 17 months. The Special Administrative Region of China has also proposed initiatives like exempting crypto gains from taxes for hedge funds, private equity, and family investment vehicles, among other regulations. title: Howard Lutnick Confirmed as US Commerce Secretary: What It Means for Trade & Crypto
body: The post Howard Lutnick Confirmed as US Commerce Secretary: What It Means for Trade & Crypto appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The US economy is currently at a crucial juncture. It appears that the newly inducted Trump administration is preparing to revamp the US crypto and trade policies. Recently, the US SEC appointed a special crypto task force to establish a clear cryptocurrency regulation framework. The US government announced trade tariffs against China, Mexico and Canada, and imposed tariffs on foreign aluminum and steel. Interestingly, at a time when the world is discussing whether US president Donald Trump Donald Trump Donald Trump is an American former president politician, businessman, and media personality, who served as the 45th president of the U.S. between 2017 to 2021. Trump earned a Bachelor of science in economics from the University of Pennsylvania in 1968. Trump won the 2016 presidential election as the Republican Party nominee against Democratic Party nominee Hillary Clinton while losing the popular vote. As president, Trump ordered a travel ban on citizens from several Muslim-majority countries, diverted military funding toward building a wall on the U.S.–Mexico border, and implemented a family separation policy. Trump has remained a prominent figure in the Republican Party and is considered a likely candidate for the 2024 presidential election President will continue his aggressive economic policies, his nominee for the position of US Commerce Secretary, Howard Lutnick – known for his pro-Bitcoin and pro-tariff views – has won Senate confirmation in a 51-45 vote. Howard Lutnick Confirmed as US Commerce Secretary Lutnick’s appointment as the US Commerce Secretary has created no surprise in many, closely watching US political developments. In November, 2024 itself, Donald Trump had already shared his intention to nominate Lutnick for the post. For Trump, choosing Lutnick for the post might be a way of repaying the hard work he put in to support the Republican candidate in the US presidential election . This business leader played a crucial role in the Republican election fundraising process during both the 2020 and 2024 presidential campaigns. Many in the business community have welcomed Lutnick’s appointment. Lutnick has been an extremely popular businessman. He was the Chairman and CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald and BGC Group. Shortly after his confirmation as the US Commerce Secretary, he stepped down from his business roles to comply with government ethics requirements. As Commerce Secretary, he will manage sensitive areas including economic statistics, census operations, and weather reporting. More importantly, he will be responsible for implementing the new administration’s aggressive import tax strategy. CONFIRMED: @howardlutnick as Secretary of Commerce. Cabinet #17. We have 5 cabinet-level confirmations left to go, plus @Kash_Patel (FBI is under DOJ—so not technically cabinet) https://t.co/2u0As9qKn6 — Markwayne Mullin (@SenMullin) February 18, 2025 Lutnick’s Trade Policy and Support for Tariffs Earlier, there were rumours that Lutnick was one of those who encouraged Donald Trump to go ahead with the aggressive import tax strategy. During the confirmation hearing, Lutnick defended Trump’s tariff strategy strongly as expected, and even denounced concerns about the potential inflationary impact of tariffs. Recently, the Trump administration imposed a 10% tariff on China. Beijing retaliated with a 15% counter-tariff on selected US goods. The US government, which had announced a similar tariff plan against Mexico and Canada February 1, froze the move two days later until March 4. The government even increased taxes on foreign steel and aluminum, indicating clearly that it is determinant to go to any extent to support local industries. .article-inside-link { margin-left: 0 !important; border: 1px solid #0052CC4D; border-left: 0; border-right: 0; padding: 10px 0; text-align: left; } .entry ul.article-inside-link li { font-size: 14px; line-height: 21px; font-weight: 600; list-style-type: none; margin-bottom: 0; display: inline-block; } .entry ul.article-inside-link li:last-child { display: none; } Also Read : Vivek Ramaswamy Pushes Bitcoin Adoption as Corporate Treasury Asset , Lutnick’s Bitcoin Advocacy and Crypto Support The appointment of Lutnick, renowned for his pro-Bitcoin stance, has triggered great excitement among crypto enthusiasts, especially the Bitcoin community. While speaking at a Bitcoin conference recently, he said: “Bitcoin is like gold and should be free trade everywhere. We will do everything in our power to make it so.” It was under Lutnick’s leadership that Cantor Fitzgerald commenced pro-crypto initiatives like a $2 billion Bitcoin financing operation. The firm’s connection with the crypto industry is not limited to BTC. The firm backs numerous progressive crypto initiatives. It oversees Tether’s US Treasury holdings. Reports suggest that the company purchased a 5% stake in Tether lately. In conclusion, Lutnick’s appointment as US Commerce Secretary marks a significant shift in both trade and crypto policies. His pro-tariff stance aligns with Trump’s economic strategy, while his Bitcoin advocacy excites the crypto community. As he takes charge, his policies could reshape US trade dynamics and crypto regulations, making his tenure one to watch closely. .article_register_shortcode { padding: 18px 24px; border-radius: 8px; display: flex; align-items: center; margin: 6px 0 22px; border: 1px solid #0052CC4D; background: linear-gradient(90deg, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1) 0%, rgba(0, 82, 204, 0.1) 100%); } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 { color: #000000; font-weight: 600; font-size: 20px; line-height: 22px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 span { color: #0052CC; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px; line-height: 22px; color: #171717B2; margin-top: 4px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body{ padding-right: 14px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-button a { float: right; } .article_register_shortcode .primary-button img{ vertical-align: middle; } @media (min-width: 581px) and (max-width: 991px) { .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { margin-bottom: 0; } } @media (max-width: 580px) { .article_register_shortcode { display: block; padding: 20px; } .article_register_shortcode img { max-width: 50px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 { font-size: 16px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body { margin-left: 0px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { font-size: 13px; line-height: 20px; margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 14px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-button a { float: unset; } .article_register_shortcode .secondary-button { margin-bottom: 0; } } Never Miss a Beat in the Crypto World! title: Dior coin crashes 90% after Dior recovers hacked account
body: The Dior coin fell more than 90% after it was revealed to be a fake Solana meme coin promoted by a hacker on the Dior official account. On Feb. 19, the official Instagram account for luxury brand Dior uploaded a post promoting a Solana ( SOL ) meme coin dubbed the Dior Official Coin alongside a pump.fun address to access the token. The post was shared to the fashion account’s 46.8 million followers. Many users in the comments section were quick to suspect the account was hacked, while others joked about the Instagram admin needing money. “DIOR OFFICIAL COIN. The exclusive luxury crypto on Pumpfun, Secure, innovative, and ready for the future,” wrote the hacker on the post’s caption, accompanied by a picture of the Dior logo on a black backdrop with the Solana logo looming above it. The post disappeared not long after the account was recovered. At the time of writing, the luxury brand still has not released any official statements acknowledging the social media hack. According to data from GeckoTerminal, the Dior coin was launched on Solana through the popular meme coin launchpad pump.fun on Feb. 19, its value skyrocketed to 138% mere minutes after its launch. In the past 24 hours, the fake Dior meme coin has accumulated a trading volume of more than $1 million. Price chart for the fake Dior coin launched pump.fun, February 19, 2025 | Source: GeckoTerminal . You might also like: Breaking Bad’s Dean Norris’ X account hacked to promote $8m crypto scam After the account was recovered and the post was deleted, the Dior coin took a plunge. The token is currently down by more than 90%, with only a slight 2% rise in the past hour. At present, there are around 876 traders still holding onto the meme coin. The Dior coin has a low liquidity of $8,730 and a fully diluted volume of $6,430. Its market cap once reached beyond $280,000, but now it stands at $6,430. According to the token’s description, the fake meme coin claims to be an “exclusive token” that caters to loyal Dior shoppers. “Dior Coin is here to shake up the crypto world! This exclusive token, launched on Pump.fun, brings a touch of luxury to the digital space. It’s not about shopping Dior, but about owning a piece of the future in style,” read the description. Earlier this month, the X account of Solana DEX aggregator Jupiter experienced a similar hack . The account was hijacked by scammers to promote a fake meme coin inspired by Jupiter’s cat mascot called MEOW. Read more: Jupiter recovers official X account after scammers promote MEOW

title: Depressed Japanese Yen: Will Limited Downside Trigger a Powerful Rebound?
body: The Japanese Yen (JPY) finds itself in a delicate situation, navigating a landscape of modest US Dollar (USD) strength and speculation surrounding future moves by the Bank of Japan (BoJ). After briefly touching a one-week high against the US Dollar, the Yen has retreated, leaving investors and traders wondering: is this just a temporary dip, or a sign of deeper weakness? This article delves into the factors influencing the Japanese Yen , exploring why its current depressed state might actually signal a limited downside and potential for future gains. Let’s unpack the dynamics at play and understand what it means for the Forex market. Navigating the Depressed Japanese Yen Amidst Modest US Dollar Strength The Japanese Yen is currently under pressure, a situation highlighted by its recent retreat against the US Dollar. This weakness comes despite the fact that many analysts believe the downside for the JPY might be limited. The USD/JPY pair has edged past the 152.00 mark, indicating a shift towards USD strength. But what’s fueling this dynamic? Several factors are contributing to the Yen’s current position: US Dollar (USD) Buying : A modest resurgence in US Dollar buying is exerting downward pressure on the Yen. This is partly due to easing concerns about immediate reciprocal tariffs from the US, as well as a slight uptick in US Treasury bond yields, making the USD relatively more attractive. Geopolitical Factors : Talks aimed at resolving the Russia-Ukraine conflict are also playing a role. Optimism surrounding these discussions reduces demand for safe-haven currencies like the Japanese Yen , as investors become slightly more risk-tolerant. Yield Differentials : While US yields are showing some rebound, the anticipated narrowing of the US-Japan yield differential is a crucial element to consider. The expectation that the BoJ will raise interest rates, coupled with potential Federal Reserve (Fed) rate cuts, could make the lower-yielding Yen more appealing in the long run. BoJ Rate Hike Expectations: A Potential Lifeline for the JPY? Despite the current headwinds, the anticipation of a BoJ rate hike is a significant factor that could prevent a deeper plunge for the Japanese Yen . Japan’s strong inflation figures and robust Q4 GDP data have solidified expectations for the Bank of Japan to tighten its monetary policy. Markets are already pricing in further interest rate increases by the BoJ before the end of the year. This hawkish stance from the BoJ is in stark contrast to the dovish signals emanating from the US Federal Reserve, creating an interesting dynamic for the USD/JPY pair. Key Points on BoJ Rate Hike Impact: Limiting JPY Depreciation : The expectation of higher interest rates in Japan makes holding Yen-denominated assets more attractive, thus limiting significant depreciation. Narrowing Yield Gap : As the BoJ raises rates and the Fed potentially cuts, the yield differential between US and Japanese bonds will narrow. This reduces the incentive to hold USD over JPY for yield purposes. Investor Confidence : A clear signal of policy tightening from the BoJ could boost investor confidence in the Japanese Yen , attracting investment flows. US Dollar Strength: Is it Sustainable? The recent US Dollar strength is playing a crucial role in the current USD/JPY dynamics. However, questions remain about the sustainability of this USD rebound. While positive news regarding tariffs and Treasury yields are providing short-term support, underlying economic data and Fed policy expectations could limit further USD gains. A surprise drop in US Retail Sales and mixed inflation signals suggest the Fed might be leaning towards rate cuts later in the year. Fed Policy and USD Outlook: Potential Rate Cuts : Market expectations for Fed rate cuts in 2025 are still prevalent, despite recent hawkish comments from some Fed officials. Economic Data Dependency : The Fed’s future policy decisions will heavily rely on incoming economic data, particularly inflation and employment figures. Any signs of further economic slowdown could strengthen the case for rate cuts and weaken the USD. Mixed Fed Signals : Recent statements from Fed officials like Harker, Bowman, and Waller highlight the internal debate within the Fed regarding inflation and the timing of rate cuts, creating uncertainty for the USD outlook. Safe-Haven Demand: Will Geopolitical Risks Resurface? The safe-haven demand for the Japanese Yen is currently subdued due to optimism surrounding Russia-Ukraine talks. However, geopolitical risks are notoriously unpredictable. Any escalation in global tensions or unexpected negative developments could quickly reignite demand for safe-haven assets, potentially benefiting the JPY. It’s important to remember that the global landscape remains fraught with uncertainties, and risk sentiment can shift rapidly. Factors that could trigger renewed safe-haven demand for JPY: Escalation of Geopolitical Conflicts : Worsening of the Russia-Ukraine war or new international conflicts. Global Economic Slowdown : Signs of a significant downturn in the global economy. Financial Market Instability : Unexpected shocks or crises in global financial markets. Technical Levels to Watch in USD/JPY From a technical analysis perspective, the USD/JPY pair is at an interesting juncture. Having failed to sustain gains above the 50% retracement level and slipping below the 200-day Simple Moving Average (SMA), the pair appears to be technically biased to the downside. However, key resistance and support levels will dictate the short-term direction. Key Technical Levels: Resistance : 152.65-152.70 (200-day SMA), 153.15 (100-day SMA), 154.45-154.50, 154.75-154.80. A break above these levels could trigger a short-covering rally. Support : 151.25, 151.00-150.90 (year-to-date low), 150.00, 149.60-149.55, 149.00, 148.65. Breaching these support levels could open the door for further declines. US Dollar Performance Against Major Currencies Today Analyzing the broader performance of the US Dollar can provide further context to the USD/JPY movement. The table below illustrates the percentage change of the USD against major currencies: USD EUR GBP JPY CAD AUD NZD CHF USD 0.27% 0.27% 0.41% 0.17% 0.14% 0.58% 0.25% EUR -0.27% -0.01% 0.14% -0.10% -0.13% 0.31% -0.02% GBP -0.27% 0.00% 0.17% -0.09% -0.12% 0.31% -0.01% JPY -0.41% -0.14% -0.17% -0.26% -0.30% 0.12% -0.19% CAD -0.17% 0.10% 0.09% 0.26% -0.04% 0.41% 0.08% AUD -0.14% 0.13% 0.12% 0.30% 0.04% 0.44% 0.10% NZD -0.58% -0.31% -0.31% -0.12% -0.41% -0.44% -0.32% CHF -0.25% 0.02% 0.01% 0.19% -0.08% -0.10% 0.32% Source: Bitcoin World Forex Data Tariffs and Trade: Understanding Trump’s Plan and Potential Impact The article mentions President Trump’s tariff plans as a factor influencing market sentiment. Understanding tariffs is crucial in today’s global economic landscape. Here’s a quick FAQ to clarify: Question Answer What are tariffs? Customs duties on imported goods, designed to protect local producers by making imports more expensive. Taxes vs. Tariffs? Tariffs are on imports, paid at entry; taxes are on domestic transactions, paid at purchase. Tariffs are by importers; taxes by individuals/businesses. Are tariffs good or bad? Debated. Proponents say they protect domestic industries. Opponents warn of higher prices and trade wars. Trump’s Tariff Plan? Focuses on reciprocal tariffs, targeting countries like Mexico, China, and Canada. Aims to boost US economy and lower income taxes using tariff revenue. Conclusion: Navigating the Yen’s Depressed State In conclusion, the Japanese Yen is currently experiencing a period of weakness, influenced by modest US Dollar strength and shifting market sentiment. However, the expectation of a BoJ rate hike provides a significant counterforce, suggesting that the downside for the JPY might indeed be limited. Factors like safe-haven demand and evolving global economic conditions will continue to play a crucial role in shaping the Yen’s trajectory. For traders and investors, keeping a close eye on BoJ policy signals, US economic data, and geopolitical developments will be paramount in navigating the complexities of the USD/JPY pair and the broader Forex market. The coming months promise to be critical for the Japanese Yen as these competing forces play out. To learn more about the latest Forex market trends, explore our articles on key developments shaping currency valuations and global economic indicators.

title: Korea’s Supreme Court rules failed TerraUSD and LUNA not financial investment products: report
body: South Korea’s Supreme Court has sided with lower courts in deciding that TerraUSD and LUNA do not meet the criteria for financial investment products. Korea ‘s Supreme Court has ruled that the collapsed stablecoin TerraUSD ( USTC ) and its sister token Terra ( LUNA ) are not financial investment products, rejecting a prosecution appeal and upholding earlier decisions, Korean newspaper Etoday reports . On Jan. 23, the court rejected prosecutors’ request to seize assets from Terraform Labs co-founder Shin Hyun-seong. The court agreed with lower courts that had already ruled LUNA does not qualify as a regulated financial product under Korea’s Capital Markets Act, stating that “related law and records show the lower court’s decision is valid.” Prosecutors argued that LUNA was some sort of security and tried to confiscate Shin’s assets, claiming he made illegal profits. Yet, courts have repeatedly ruled that LUNA does not meet the legal definition of a security or financial investment product. You might also like: THORChain ‘eerily similar’ to Terra Luna implosion: Osmosis co-founder Capital Markets Act does not apply Lawyer Kim Jung-chul from Law Firm Woori said the ruling does not just dismiss LUNA’s security status, but also “confirms that the Capital Markets Act does not apply, meaning asset seizure based on that law is not possible.” Despite the ruling, Shin and other Terraform executives still face fraud charges. Prosecutors say they misled investors and manipulated the market to profit from the Terra blockchain. Do Kwon , the key figure behind Terra, was extradited from Montenegro and appeared in a Manhattan court in January on federal fraud charges. A U.S. grand jury indicted Kwon for inflating Terraform’s crypto prices and laundering funds. The collapse of Terra in May 2022 wiped out over $40 billion, causing major losses for investors worldwide. Read more: LUNC price rises as total Terra Classic nears a 403B milestone

title: Unwavering Gold Price: Safe Haven Shines Above $2,900 Despite USD Strength
body: Cryptocurrency markets are known for their volatility, but even seasoned crypto investors keep a close eye on traditional safe-haven assets like Gold. Why? Because Gold’s performance often reflects broader economic anxieties that can ripple through all markets, including digital currencies. Currently, the Gold Price is demonstrating remarkable resilience, hovering above $2,900. But is this stability a calm before a storm, or a sign of Gold’s enduring strength in a turbulent world? Why is the Gold Price Showing Unwavering Strength as a Safe Haven? Despite fluctuations in other asset classes, Gold Price continues to attract buyers, marking its second consecutive day of gains. This persistent appeal can be attributed to a confluence of factors, primarily rooted in global economic uncertainties and expectations surrounding monetary policy: Escalating Trade War Concerns: US President Trump’s threats of reciprocal tariffs are igniting fears of a global trade war. In times of international trade friction, investors often flock to safe haven assets like Gold, perceived as a store of value outside the traditional financial system. Anticipation of Further Fed Rate Cuts: The market is increasingly betting on the Federal Reserve to implement further interest rate cuts later this year. Lower interest rates diminish the opportunity cost of holding non-yielding assets like Gold, making it a more attractive investment. These elements are providing a solid foundation for Gold’s current price stability. However, it’s not all smooth sailing for the precious metal. What Factors are Capping Gold Price Gains? While Gold Price is holding firm, several headwinds are preventing it from breaking out into a significant rally. These factors introduce a degree of caution for bullish investors: Rebounding US Bond Yields: A recent uptick in US Treasury bond yields is making bonds relatively more appealing compared to Gold. As bond yields rise, they can draw investment away from non-yielding assets. Modest USD Strength: The US Dollar is showing signs of recovery after hitting multi-week lows. A stronger USD typically exerts downward pressure on Gold Price , as Gold is priced in US Dollars, becoming more expensive for holders of other currencies. Easing Geopolitical Tensions (Potentially): Optimism surrounding potential delays in US tariff implementation and talks aimed at resolving the Russia-Ukraine conflict could slightly dampen the urgency for safe haven assets. However, these situations remain fluid and uncertain. Despite these capping factors, Gold bulls seem unfazed, suggesting underlying conviction in Gold’s long-term value proposition. Decoding Fed Speak: Will Fed Rate Cuts Fuel the Next Gold Price Rally? Federal Reserve policy decisions are crucial drivers for Gold Price movements. Recent statements from Fed officials offer mixed signals, adding complexity to the outlook for interest rate cuts and their impact on Gold: Data-Dependent Approach: Philadelphia Fed President Patrick Harker emphasized a data-driven approach, suggesting a steady policy stance for now, citing sticky inflation and a balanced labor market. Inflation Concerns: Fed Governor Michelle Bowman pointed to high asset prices potentially hindering inflation progress, indicating a need for more definitive signs of declining inflation before considering rate cuts. Conditional Rate Cut Outlook: Fed Governor Christopher Waller suggested that rate cuts would be appropriate in 2025 if inflation trends mirror the disinflationary pattern observed in 2024. Market expectations, reflected in Fed Funds Futures, currently price in a possibility of a 40 basis point rate cut in 2025. The timing and magnitude of these cuts will be pivotal in determining the future trajectory of Gold Price . Technical Outlook: Is Gold Poised for a Breakout or a Breakdown? From a technical analysis perspective, Gold Price action reveals a market in consolidation: Range-Bound Trading: Gold has been trading within a narrow range for the past week, characterized as a bullish consolidation following a recent surge to record highs. Positive Momentum Indicators: Oscillators on the daily chart remain in positive territory, suggesting the path of least resistance may still be upward. Overbought RSI and Resistance Levels: The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is nearing overbought territory, indicating potential for price pullback. Navigating the Gold Market: Key Takeaways for Investors The current Gold Price environment presents a nuanced picture. Here’s what investors should consider: Monitor Trade War Developments: Escalating trade tensions are a significant bullish catalyst for Gold. Pay close attention to any news regarding tariffs and international trade relations. Track Fed Policy Signals: Federal Reserve statements and economic data releases will heavily influence interest rate expectations and, consequently, Gold Price . Stay informed about FOMC member speeches and key economic indicators. USD and Bond Yield Dynamics: Keep an eye on US Dollar strength and Treasury bond yields, as these factors can exert opposing pressures on Gold. Gold Price: A Timeless Safe Haven in a World of Uncertainty Despite short-term fluctuations and range-bound trading, Gold Price continues to demonstrate its enduring appeal as a safe haven asset. In a world grappling with geopolitical risks, trade uncertainties, and evolving monetary policies, Gold’s role as a store of value and a hedge against economic turmoil remains firmly intact. Whether it breaks higher or tests lower support levels in the near term, Gold’s fundamental importance in a diversified investment portfolio is undeniable, especially for those navigating the volatile landscape of cryptocurrency and broader financial markets. title: Urgent Alert: USD/INR *Surges* on Foreign Funds Outflows & Relentless US Dollar Demand – What’s Next for Indian Rupee?
body: Buckle up, crypto enthusiasts and Forex traders! The Indian Rupee (INR) is facing a turbulent ride against the US Dollar (USD). Today’s early trading sessions are showing a significant uptick in USD/INR, leaving many wondering what’s driving this surge and what it means for the Indian economy and the broader Forex market. Let’s dive into the critical factors fueling this currency movement and explore what could happen next. Why is USD/INR on a *Surge*? Decoding the Forex Dynamics Several factors are converging to push the USD/INR exchange rate higher. Let’s break down the key drivers: Foreign Funds Outflows: Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) are pulling money out of Indian markets. This exodus creates a higher demand for US Dollars as these investors convert their INR holdings back to USD, weakening the Indian Rupee. Robust US Dollar Demand: The US Dollar is gaining strength globally. This is partly due to its safe-haven appeal amidst global economic uncertainties and anticipation of future US economic data releases. Trade Deficit Woes: India’s trade deficit widened in January, indicating that imports are exceeding exports. This necessitates more US Dollars to pay for imports, further driving up USD demand and impacting the Indian Rupee negatively. Geopolitical Tensions: The looming threat of a global trade war, sparked by potential tariff measures from the US, adds another layer of uncertainty. Such tensions typically boost the US Dollar as investors seek safer assets. Think of it like this: imagine a seesaw. On one side, you have the Indian Rupee, and on the other, the US Dollar. Right now, heavy weights like foreign funds outflows and global risk aversion are being placed on the US Dollar side, causing the INR side to lift – meaning the USD/INR rate rises. RBI Intervention: Can it *Rescue* the Indian Rupee? The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is often seen as a key player in managing Indian Rupee volatility. In situations like this, the RBI might step in to stabilize the currency. How might they do this? Direct Intervention: The RBI can directly sell US Dollars from its reserves and buy Rupees. This increases the supply of USD and demand for INR in the market, potentially curbing the Rupee’s fall. Interest Rate Adjustments: While not explicitly mentioned in the current news snippet as an immediate action, the RBI could use interest rate hikes to attract foreign investment and make holding Rupees more attractive. However, this is a broader policy tool and not always used for short-term currency management. Analysts suggest that RBI intervention could indeed limit the extent of the INR’s losses. However, the effectiveness of intervention depends on the scale and persistence of the factors driving the USD/INR upwards. It’s a balancing act for the RBI. Analyzing the Forex Technicals: USD/INR Chart Outlook Let’s peek at the technical picture for USD/INR. According to the daily chart analysis mentioned in the news: Bullish Trend Intact: The USD/INR pair remains in a bullish trend, trading above the 100-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA). This suggests the upward momentum is still strong. RSI Indicator: The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is above the midline, further supporting the bullish outlook. Key Resistance Levels: The immediate resistance is around 87.00. Breaking above this could push the pair towards its all-time high near 88.00 and potentially 88.50. Support Levels: On the downside, immediate support is around 86.35 (February 12 low), followed by 86.14 (January 27 low). In simple terms, technical indicators suggest that the path of least resistance for USD/INR is currently upwards. Traders are watching these levels closely for potential breakout or breakdown scenarios in the Forex market. Understanding the Broader Impact: Indian Economy and the Rupee The strength or weakness of the Indian Rupee is intricately linked to the Indian economy. Let’s address some frequently asked questions to understand this connection better: How does the Indian economy impact the Indian Rupee? A robust Indian economy generally supports a stronger Rupee. High economic growth attracts foreign investment (both FDI and FII), increasing demand for the INR. Conversely, economic slowdown or negative economic news can weaken the Rupee. Key Economic Indicators & INR Impact: Economic Factor Positive Impact on INR Negative Impact on INR Economic Growth Higher growth attracts investment, strengthens INR Slower growth reduces investment, weakens INR Foreign Investment (FDI & FII) Increased inflows boost INR demand, strengthens INR Outflows reduce INR demand, weakens INR Exports Higher exports increase INR demand, strengthens INR Lower exports reduce INR demand, weakens INR Imports Lower imports reduce USD demand, strengthens INR Higher imports increase USD demand, weakens INR What is the impact of Oil prices on the Rupee *Exchange Rate*? India is a major oil importer. Since oil is primarily traded in US Dollars, rising oil prices increase India’s USD demand. This puts downward pressure on the Currency , as more Rupees are needed to buy the same amount of USD for oil imports. Conversely, falling oil prices can ease pressure on the INR. How does inflation in India impact the Rupee? Inflation’s impact is complex. High inflation erodes the Rupee’s value over time. However, if inflation rises above the RBI’s target, the RBI may raise interest rates to combat it. Higher interest rates can attract foreign investment, potentially strengthening the Rupee. But persistently high inflation can ultimately be detrimental to the Exchange Rate . How does seasonal US Dollar demand from importers and banks impact the Rupee? India’s import-heavy trade structure means there’s consistent demand for US Dollars. Seasonal factors or large import orders can create surges in USD demand. During these periods, the Rupee tends to weaken as importers buy more USD. Similarly, during periods of market volatility, the demand for the US Dollar as a safe-haven asset can spike, also weakening the Rupee. Actionable Insights for Forex Traders For those trading USD/INR or involved in the Forex market, here are some actionable insights based on the current scenario: Monitor FII Flows: Keep an eye on foreign investment trends. Continued outflows will likely keep pressure on the INR. Track US Dollar Index: The strength of the US Dollar globally is a major factor. Follow the US Dollar Index (DXY) for broader USD movements. Watch RBI Actions: Be alert for any potential RBI interventions or policy announcements that could impact the Rupee. Analyze Technical Levels: Pay attention to the key support and resistance levels mentioned in the technical analysis for potential trading opportunities. Stay Informed on Global Events: Geopolitical developments and global economic news, especially related to trade and US economic data, can significantly influence USD/INR. Conclusion: Navigating the USD/INR Volatility The USD/INR pair is currently experiencing upward pressure due to a confluence of factors, including foreign funds outflows, strong US Dollar demand, and trade deficit concerns. While RBI intervention might offer some respite, the underlying trends suggest continued volatility. For traders and businesses dealing with Currency fluctuations, staying informed, monitoring key indicators, and understanding the dynamics of the Exchange Rate are crucial for navigating these uncertain times. The situation remains fluid, and close observation of market developments is essential. To learn more about the latest Forex market trends, explore our articles on key developments shaping US Dollar and other major currencies.

title: Australian Dollar Resilient: Trims Losses Despite RBA’s Interest Rate Cut – Expert Forex Forecast
body: In a surprising turn of events in the volatile world of forex trading, the Australian Dollar (AUD) demonstrated remarkable resilience, trimming its losses despite the Reserve Bank of Australia’s (RBA) anticipated decision to cut interest rates. Did the markets anticipate this move, or is there more to the story behind the Aussie’s defiance? Let’s dive into the details and explore what this means for traders and the broader economic landscape. Decoding the RBA’s Interest Rate Decision and Market Reaction On Tuesday, the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) announced its Interest Rate Decision , reducing the Official Cash Rate by 25 basis points to 4.10%. This move, while widely expected, marks the first rate cut in four years and signals a potential shift in the RBA’s monetary policy. The central bank’s decision comes amid signs of easing inflation, with recent data indicating slowing price pressures in Australia. Here’s a quick breakdown of the key economic indicators influencing the RBA’s decision: Easing Inflation: December data revealed a slowdown in price pressures, prompting speculation about the RBA’s next move. Consumer Price Index (CPI): The quarterly CPI rose less than expected in Q4 2024, indicating cooling inflation. Trimmed Mean CPI: The RBA’s preferred inflation measure rose by 0.5% for the quarter, below the 0.6% forecast, and the annualized rate fell to 3.2% from 3.5%. Despite the rate cut, which is typically seen as bearish for a currency, the Australian Dollar showed surprising strength. Why did the Aussie Dollar not plummet as expected? Several factors are at play, contributing to this unexpected market reaction. Why Did the Australian Dollar Defy Expectations? The Australian Dollar Forecast remains a subject of intense scrutiny, especially after this unexpected reaction to the RBA’s rate cut. While a rate cut usually weakens a currency, the AUD’s resilience can be attributed to a combination of domestic and international factors: Anticipated Rate Cut: The market had largely priced in the 25 basis points rate cut. As the cut was widely expected, its announcement didn’t trigger a significant negative reaction. US Dollar Weakness: Simultaneously, the US Dollar (USD) experienced weakness due to disappointing US retail sales data, fueling speculation about potential Federal Reserve (Fed) rate cuts later in the year. This USD weakness provided a cushion for the AUD/USD pair. Trump Tariff Delay: Former US President Donald Trump’s decision to delay the implementation of reciprocal tariffs provided additional support to the AUD/USD pair, easing concerns about trade tensions. Improved Treasury Yields & US Dollar Rebound (Counter-Narrative): It’s important to note the nuanced push and pull. While initial USD weakness helped AUD, the US Dollar Index (DXY) later edged higher as US Treasury yields improved. This highlights the complex interplay of factors influencing currency valuations. AUD/USD Analysis : Navigating the Ascending Channel Currently trading near 0.6340, the AUD/USD pair is navigating an ascending channel pattern, suggesting a bullish market sentiment. Technical indicators further reinforce this outlook: Ascending Channel: The upward trend within this channel indicates sustained buying interest in the AUD/USD pair. 14-day Relative Strength Index (RSI): Remaining above 50, the RSI supports the bullish momentum, suggesting further potential gains. However, traders should be mindful of key resistance and support levels: Level Value Upper Channel Boundary (Resistance 1) 0.6390 Psychological Resistance 0.6400 9-day EMA (Support 1) 0.6316 14-day EMA (Support 2) 0.6300 Lower Channel Boundary (Strong Support) 0.6280 A break above the 0.6390-0.6400 resistance zone could signal a stronger bullish move, while a fall below the 0.6280 support could indicate a potential trend reversal. Global Economic Factors and the Forex Market News Landscape The broader Forex Market News cycle is heavily influenced by global economic factors. Recent statements from US Federal Reserve officials and economic data releases are adding layers of complexity to the currency markets. Fed Officials’ Cautious Stance: Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman and Governor Christopher Waller have both emphasized a cautious approach to interest rate cuts, citing persistent inflation concerns and the need for more data-driven decision-making. Disappointing US Retail Sales: A significant 0.9% drop in US Retail Sales in January, far exceeding expectations, initially weakened the US Dollar and fueled speculation about earlier Fed rate cuts. Powell’s Dovish Tone, but Data Dependent: Fed Chair Jerome Powell, while acknowledging a strong job market and economy, indicated no urgency to cut rates, emphasizing data dependency and the potential upward pressure from tariffs. China’s Pro-Private Sector Stance: Chinese President Xi Jinping’s meeting with private sector leaders signals renewed support for the private sector, which could positively impact global economic recovery and indirectly influence currency markets. Navigating the Interest Rate Cut and Interest Rate Forecast Understanding the implications of an Interest Rate Cut is crucial for forex traders. The RBA’s move, while initially expected to weaken the AUD, has been met with a nuanced market response. Here’s what you need to consider: Short-term Volatility: Rate cuts often lead to increased volatility in the currency markets. Traders should be prepared for potential price swings in the AUD/USD and related pairs. Long-term Economic Impact: The effectiveness of the rate cut in stimulating the Australian economy and managing inflation will be a key factor in the Australian Dollar’s long-term performance. Global Rate Divergence: The divergence in monetary policy between the RBA and other central banks, particularly the US Federal Reserve, will continue to influence currency valuations. Any shift in expectations regarding Fed policy will significantly impact the AUD/USD pair. Data Dependency: Both the RBA and the Fed are emphasizing data dependency. Upcoming economic data releases from both Australia and the US will be critical in shaping future market expectations and currency movements. Australian Dollar Performance Snapshot: Below is a snapshot of the Australian Dollar’s performance against major currencies today. Notice its relative strength despite the RBA’s rate cut, especially against currencies other than the US Dollar. Australian Dollar PRICE Today USD EUR GBP JPY CAD AUD NZD CHF USD 0.16% 0.16% 0.36% 0.09% 0.20% 0.50% 0.12% EUR -0.16% 0.00% 0.19% -0.07% 0.04% 0.34% -0.04% GBP -0.16% -0.00% 0.21% -0.07% 0.04% 0.34% -0.04% JPY -0.36% -0.19% -0.21% -0.27% -0.16% 0.12% -0.25% CAD -0.09% 0.07% 0.07% 0.27% 0.11% 0.41% 0.03% AUD -0.20% -0.04% -0.04% 0.16% -0.11% 0.30% -0.09% NZD -0.50% -0.34% -0.34% -0.12% -0.41% -0.30% -0.37% CHF -0.12% 0.04% 0.04% 0.25% -0.03% 0.09% 0.37% The heat map above visualizes percentage changes of major currencies against each other. Base currency from the left, quote currency from the top. Conclusion: A Resilient Aussie Dollar in a Complex Forex Landscape The Australian Dollar’s ability to trim losses despite the RBA’s rate cut highlights the complexities of the forex market. While the rate cut introduces a dovish element, factors such as US Dollar weakness, technical positioning, and global economic sentiments are currently providing counter-support. Traders should closely monitor upcoming economic data, central bank communications, and global risk events to navigate the evolving forex market landscape and make informed decisions regarding the Australian Dollar and AUD/USD trading. title: Founder of Trump's World Liberty Financial Credits Justin Sun for Project's Success
body: HONG KONG — World Liberty Financial, the Donald Trump-backed crypto project, owes much of its early success to Justin Sun, the Chinese-born crypto billionaire who became an official advisor to the project after purchasing $30 million worth of its token, WLFI, said World Liberty co-founder Zak Folkman. Folkman remarked that, "the goal of the project is being able to create progress to actually merge traditional financial institutions with decentralized finance,” in a panel at CoinDesk's Consensus Hong Kong conference. For several weeks, the Trump-endorsed WLFI faced lackluster sales, failing to reach its $30 million fundraising target. The token was restricted from trading and only available to non-U.S. investors and accredited U.S. investors. The project's fortunes changed, however, when Sun stepped in. “This guy,” Folkman said with a gesture towards Sun, “saw that regardless of the outcome, this project is a monumental move forward for the entire crypto community.” When Trump announced World Liberty Financial alongside his sons in October, they said it would be a lending platform based on Aave — a popular Ethereum-based decentralized finance protocol. The platform has yet to launch, but according to Folkman, World Liberty is now developing "a whole range of products and applications" — not just a single tool. Today, World Liberty Financial is known for WLFI, the governance token that it put up for sale mere days after the project was unveiled. "When we were launching this project, it was a very heated time," Folkman told the panel. "There was a lot of scrutiny on our project due to who was involved." After Sun's 10-figure endorsement, “everything kind of snowballed from there,” said Folkman. World Liberty not only oversold its fundraising target, but it eventually set a new one. Should it meet its new goal — which it seems poised to do soon — Folkman noted that WLFI will become the fourth-largest initial coin offering (ICO) of all time. Folkman claims WLFI's success came despite "no VC backing and no special treatment to anybody who purchased the token." Sun, however, was elevated to an official World Liberty investor after his WLFI purchase. World Liberty also bought $10 million worth of TRX tokens — the native token of Sun's TRON blockchain — and WBTC, a Sun-linked bitcoin derivative. Earlier in Feb., Blockworks reported that World Liberty has been shopping a deal to crypto teams: If a company purchases WLFI tokens and pays an additional fee, World Liberty will add that company's tokens to its portfolio — a powerful marketing instrument for up-and-coming crypto tokens. “I’ve seen that going around," Folkman said of the report. "The person who was going out and purporting to represent us was not connected with our company.”

title: Critical USD/CAD Forecast: Canadian CPI Inflation Data Sparks Downside Break Alert!
body: Buckle up, crypto enthusiasts and forex traders! The USD/CAD pair is currently navigating choppy waters, and all eyes are glued to the upcoming Canadian Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation data. Will this economic indicator trigger a significant downside move? Let’s dive into the technical analysis and market outlook to uncover potential trading opportunities. Decoding the USD/CAD Forecast: Will Inflation Data Trigger a Downside Move? As of Tuesday’s early European session, the USD/CAD pair is hovering around 1.4205, showing some resilience thanks to a slightly firmer US Dollar. However, the overall sentiment leans bearish, particularly as we approach the release of the Canadian CPI inflation figures. This data release is the key event to watch today, potentially setting the stage for the next significant price swing in the USD/CAD pair. Key Factors Influencing the USD/CAD Forecast Several factors are currently at play, shaping the USD/CAD forecast . Here’s a breakdown: Technical Indicators Point to Bearish Momentum: The 4-hour chart reveals that USD/CAD is trading below the crucial 100-period Exponential Moving Average (EMA). This is a significant bearish signal. Further reinforcing this negative outlook is the Relative Strength Index (RSI), which sits below the midline, indicating persistent selling pressure. Canadian CPI Inflation Data in Focus: The highlight of the day is undoubtedly the Canadian CPI inflation data for January. Economists anticipate a year-over-year increase of 1.8%. Month-on-month, the forecast suggests a rise to 0.1% from December’s -0.4%. These figures are critical as they will influence the Bank of Canada’s (BoC) future monetary policy decisions. Potential Impact of Inflation Data: Higher-than-expected Canadian CPI inflation could strengthen the Canadian Dollar. Why? Because it might push the Bank of Canada to maintain or even increase interest rates to combat rising prices. Higher interest rates generally attract foreign investment, boosting demand for the local currency. Technical Levels to Watch: For traders tracking currency trading , understanding key support and resistance levels is crucial. Let’s map out the immediate zones: USD/CAD Key Technical Levels Level Type Price Significance First Downside Target (Support) 1.4151 February 14 Low Next Support Level 1.4130 Bollinger Band Lower Limit Psychological Support 1.4100 Round Number Level Immediate Resistance 1.4265 Bollinger Band Upper Limit Key Resistance (EMA) 1.4310 100-period EMA Further Resistance 1.4380 February 10 High Navigating Currency Trading: What Does This Mean for Traders? For those involved in currency trading , the current technical setup and upcoming CPI release present potential opportunities. Here’s a trader’s perspective: Bearish Scenario: If the Canadian CPI inflation data meets or exceeds expectations, we could see a push below the initial support at 1.4151. A successful break could accelerate the downside momentum, targeting 1.4130 and potentially the 1.4100 psychological level. Bullish Scenario (Less Likely): To negate the current bearish bias, USD/CAD needs to decisively break above the 1.4265 resistance. This could open the door for a move towards the 100-period EMA at 1.4310, and further gains could challenge the 1.4380 level. However, given the prevailing technical indicators, a significant bullish move seems less probable in the immediate term, unless the CPI data drastically disappoints. Focus on Risk Management: Regardless of the direction, robust risk management is paramount. Traders should employ stop-loss orders to protect capital and avoid excessive leverage, especially during volatile periods around economic data releases. Understanding Technical Analysis in Forex News Technical analysis is a cornerstone of forex trading, and in this forex news scenario, it provides valuable insights. The use of moving averages like the 100-period EMA, the RSI, and Bollinger Bands are standard tools for identifying trends and potential turning points. The fact that USD/CAD is below the 100-period EMA and the RSI is bearishly positioned underscores the current downward pressure. These tools, combined with fundamental analysis like monitoring Canadian CPI inflation , equip traders to make more informed decisions. The Broader Forex News Landscape Beyond USD/CAD and Canadian CPI inflation , the broader forex news landscape is always dynamic. Factors such as: Global Economic Health: The overall health of the global economy, particularly the US and Canada, plays a significant role in currency valuations. Central Bank Policies: Monetary policy decisions from the Bank of Canada and the Federal Reserve are crucial drivers. Interest rate differentials between the two countries significantly impact the USD/CAD exchange rate. Commodity Prices: As Canada is a major oil exporter, fluctuations in oil prices can influence the Canadian Dollar. Higher oil prices often support the CAD. Market Sentiment: Risk appetite in global markets also affects currency flows. In risk-on environments, commodity currencies like the CAD may benefit. Conclusion: Navigating the USD/CAD Landscape with CPI Data in Sight The USD/CAD pair is at a critical juncture. The technical picture currently favors the bears, and the upcoming Canadian CPI inflation data is poised to be the catalyst for the next directional move. Traders should closely monitor the 1.4151 support level and the 1.4265 resistance. Staying informed, utilizing technical analysis , and practicing prudent risk management are key to navigating the potential volatility in currency trading . Keep an eye on the forex news wires for the latest updates and market reactions as the CPI data unfolds! To learn more about the latest Forex market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping currency trading dynamics.

title: Steady Aussie Dollar: Decoding the RBA’s Rate Cut Surprise
body: The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) delivered a widely anticipated rate cut, but the Australian Dollar (AUD) refused to budge significantly. In a move that sent ripples through the Forex market, the RBA lowered its Official Cash Rate by 25 basis points to 4.10%. Was this a seismic shift or just a ripple? Let’s dive into why the Aussie Dollar is showing surprising resilience and what it means for traders. Decoding the RBA’s Interest Rate Cut: A Forex Market Perspective On Tuesday, February 18, 2025, the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) executed its first interest rate cut in four years, bringing the Official Cash Rate down to 4.10%. This decision, while expected by many, marks a significant shift in monetary policy. Governor Michele Bullock addressed the media, acknowledging the impact of high interest rates but cautioned against prematurely celebrating victory over inflation. The central bank’s move reflects concerns about slowing price pressures, highlighted by recent data showing a dip in Australia’s Consumer Price Index (CPI). The Trimmed Mean CPI, the RBA’s preferred inflation gauge, also showed a slower quarterly increase than anticipated. Here’s a breakdown of the key factors surrounding the RBA rate cut: The Cut: A 25 basis point reduction in the Official Cash Rate, bringing it to 4.10%. Rationale: Slowing inflation and the impact of previous high interest rates on the economy. Governor Bullock’s Stance: Acknowledged the impact of rates but emphasized it’s too early to declare victory on inflation, pointing to a strong jobs market. Bank Response: Australia’s “Big Four” banks—CBA, NAB, ANZ, and Westpac—swiftly followed suit, reducing their interest rates by 25 basis points. Why Did the Australian Dollar Remain Steady? Unpacking the AUD/USD Reaction Despite the dovish signal of an interest rate cut, the Australian Dollar (AUD) demonstrated remarkable stability. The AUD/USD pair experienced only minor fluctuations, suggesting that traders had already factored in the RBA’s decision. This ‘priced in’ phenomenon is common in Forex markets, where anticipation of major events often leads to adjustments before the actual announcement. Moreover, other global factors are currently at play, influencing the AUD/USD dynamic. Consider these elements contributing to the Australian Dollar’s steadiness: Market Anticipation: The rate cut was widely expected, diminishing its immediate impact on the AUD. US Dollar Weakness: Disappointing US retail sales data fueled speculation about potential Federal Reserve (Fed) rate cuts, weakening the US Dollar (USD) and providing some support to the AUD/USD pair. Trump Tariff Delay: President Trump’s decision to postpone reciprocal tariffs offered additional, albeit temporary, support to the AUD. Interest Rates and Inflation: The Global Balancing Act While the RBA is easing monetary policy, the global landscape remains complex. Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman recently highlighted persistent upside inflation risks in the US, stressing the need for more clarity before considering US rate cuts. This divergence in central bank approaches creates an interesting dynamic in the Forex market. Higher US Treasury yields, particularly on 2-year and 10-year bonds, are currently bolstering the US Dollar Index (DXY), which measures the USD against six major currencies. This strengthening USD presents headwinds for the Australian Dollar. Here’s a comparative look at the factors influencing interest rate decisions and inflation: Factor Australia (RBA) United States (Fed) Recent Rate Decision Cut by 25 bps to 4.10% On hold, current range 5.25%-5.50% Inflation Concerns Slowing inflation, but still above target Persistent upside risks, progress slow Economic Outlook Impact of high rates felt, strong jobs market Solid economic growth, strong job market Future Rate Path Further cuts not guaranteed, data-dependent No hurry to cut, data-dependent Navigating the AUD/USD Landscape: Technical Analysis and Key Levels From a technical analysis perspective, the AUD/USD pair is currently trading around 0.6340, exhibiting an upward trend within an ascending channel. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) above 50 reinforces a bullish bias. For traders watching the Forex news, key levels to monitor include: Resistance: 0.6390 (upper channel boundary), 0.6400 (psychological resistance). Support: 0.6316 (9-day EMA), 0.6300 (14-day EMA), 0.6280 (lower channel boundary). AUD/USD Daily Chart Snapshot: [*Instruction: Image tag removed as per instructions*] Australian Dollar Performance Today: A Currency Heat Map Looking at the day’s currency movements, the Australian Dollar shows a mixed performance against major currencies. As indicated in the heat map below, the AUD is weakest against the US Dollar but shows gains against other currencies like the New Zealand Dollar (NZD). This snapshot provides a quick visual representation of the Australian Dollar’s relative strength in the Forex market today. Australian Dollar PRICE Today (Percentage Change vs. Major Currencies) [*Instruction: Table data provided in the original content, to be rendered as a table without HTML table tags as per instructions, but maintaining data structure.*] Australian Dollar was the weakest against the US Dollar. USD EUR GBP JPY CAD AUD NZD CHFUSD 0.22% 0.23% 0.33% 0.14% 0.12% 0.53% 0.19%EUR -0.22% 0.00% 0.10% -0.08% -0.10% 0.31% -0.03%GBP -0.23% -0.00% 0.11% -0.09% -0.10% 0.31% -0.03%JPY -0.33% -0.10% -0.11% -0.20% -0.21% 0.18% -0.15%CAD -0.14% 0.08% 0.09% 0.20% -0.02% 0.40% 0.05%AUD -0.12% 0.10% 0.10% 0.21% 0.02% 0.41% 0.06%NZD -0.53% -0.31% -0.31% -0.18% -0.40% -0.41% -0.34%CHF -0.19% 0.03% 0.03% 0.15% -0.05% -0.06% 0.34% The heat map shows percentage changes of major currencies against each other. The base currency is picked from the left column, while the quote currency is picked from the top row. For example, if you pick the Australian Dollar from the left column and move along the horizontal line to the US Dollar, the percentage change displayed in the box will represent AUD (base)/USD (quote). Australian Dollar FAQs: Key Drivers and Influences Understanding the Australian Dollar requires considering a range of factors beyond just interest rates. Here are some frequently asked questions to provide deeper insights: What key factors drive the Australian Dollar? RBA Interest Rates: A primary driver. Higher rates generally support the AUD. Iron Ore Prices: As a major export, iron ore prices significantly impact the AUD. Chinese Economy: China’s economic health, being Australia’s largest trading partner, is crucial. Australian Economic Health: Inflation, growth rate, and trade balance are all important. Market Sentiment: Risk appetite influences the AUD, with risk-on sentiment generally positive for the AUD. How do the decisions of the Reserve Bank of Australia impact the Australian Dollar? The RBA’s monetary policy decisions, primarily interest rate adjustments, are pivotal. Higher interest rates make the AUD more attractive to foreign investors seeking yield, increasing demand and value. Conversely, lower rates can weaken the AUD. Quantitative easing and tightening measures by the RBA also influence the currency. How does the health of the Chinese Economy impact the Australian Dollar? China’s robust economic growth translates to increased demand for Australian exports, particularly raw materials. This heightened demand boosts the AUD. Economic slowdowns in China have the opposite effect, reducing demand for the AUD and potentially weakening it. Chinese economic data releases often directly impact the AUD. How does the price of Iron Ore impact the Australian Dollar? Iron ore is Australia’s top export. Rising iron ore prices increase Australia’s export earnings, improving the trade balance and bolstering demand for the AUD. Falling iron ore prices have the reverse effect, potentially weakening the AUD. How does the Trade Balance impact the Australian Dollar? A positive trade balance, where exports exceed imports, indicates strong demand for a country’s goods and services. This surplus demand naturally strengthens the country’s currency, in this case, the Australian Dollar. A negative trade balance can weaken the AUD. Conclusion: Navigating Forex Markets in a Dynamic Environment The Australian Dollar’s steady reaction to the RBA rate cut underscores the complex interplay of factors influencing Forex markets. While the rate cut itself is a significant event, global economic conditions, US Dollar dynamics, and commodity prices all contribute to the AUD’s valuation. For Forex traders, understanding these interconnected elements is crucial for making informed decisions in this ever-evolving landscape. Keep a close watch on upcoming economic data releases from both Australia and the US, as well as global risk sentiment, to anticipate future movements in the AUD/USD and broader Forex markets. To learn more about the latest Forex market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping interest rates and liquidity.

title: Bitget Launches A New Round of Global Builders Recruitment to Co-build the Bitget Ecosystem
body: Victoria, Seychelles, February 19th, 2025, Chainwire Bitget , the leading cryptocurrency exchange and Web3 company, announced the expansion of its global recruitment initiative Bitget Builders Program which invites crypto enthusiasts from various backgrounds to co-build the Bitget ecosystem while unlocking exclusive benefits, event access, and growth opportunities. Starting February 2025, the Bitget Builders Program will launch a long-term global recruitment of builders who are exploring deeply in blockchain industry and in line with Bitget's vision of driving blockchain innovation and adoption. The recruitment program is not limited to any specific country, so applications for this program are invited from all over the world. Builders will engage in a variety of roles that align with their skills and interests while gaining rewards for their contributions. Top-performing participants will have the opportunity to earn exclusive invitations to Token 2049 in Dubai, as well as a face-to-face meetup with Bitget COO Vugar Usi Zade. " Build Bitget with Vugar " events will serve as a dialogue between Bitget's leadership and its global community. Bitget COO Vugar Usi Zade will lead a series of interactive sessions to share insights into Bitget's strategic vision, core values, and future roadmap. Through AMAs, workshops, and networking sessions, participants will gain firsthand knowledge of Bitget's ecosystem strategy and collaborate on shaping its evolution. So far over 5,000 participants in Bitget Builders Program have played a significant role in Bitget's global expansion by organizing community events, promoting high-profile projects, and managing local engagement. This year, community managers will be upgraded to Bitget Builders and gain enhanced benefits. In addition, Bitget Builders will spearhead the "Global Meetup Tour", kicking off in cities around the world to expand Bitget's global footprint and strengthen community ties. "The Bitget Builders Program embodies our belief in community-driven growth. By empowering builders with resources and recognition, we're accelerating the creation of a more inclusive and innovative crypto ecosystem," said Vugar Usi Zade, COO at Bitget . "Bitget believes Gen Z and younger crypto users, who grow up with the increasing adoption of crypto, will be playing a vital role in promoting crypto adoption. We're excited to meet passionate individuals worldwide through our events and build Bitget's future together." The Bitget Builders Program is a pivotal component of the Blockchain4Youth charity project, which aims to empower young talents and foster innovation within the crypto space. This innovative initiative has successfully brought participants from more than 55 countries and is dedicated to providing opportunities with thriving Web3 talents, deeply integrating the next generation of crypto leaders into the Bitget ecosystem, and fostering a robust crypto community. For more details on the Bitget Builders Program, users can visit here . About Bitget Established in 2018, Bitget is the world's leading cryptocurrency exchange and Web3 company. Serving over 100 million users in 150+ countries and regions, the Bitget exchange is committed to helping users trade smarter with its pioneering copy trading feature and other trading solutions, while offering real-time access to Bitcoin price , Ethereum price , and other cryptocurrency prices. Formerly known as BitKeep, Bitget Wallet is a world-class multi-chain crypto wallet that offers an array of comprehensive Web3 solutions and features including wallet functionality, token swap, NFT Marketplace, DApp browser, and more. Bitget is at the forefront of driving crypto adoption through strategic partnerships, such as its role as the Official Crypto Partner of the World's Top Football League, LALIGA , in EASTERN, SEA and LATAM market, as well as a global partner of Turkish National athletes Buse Tosun Çavuşoğlu (Wrestling world champion), Samet Gümüş (Boxing gold medalist) and İlkin Aydın (Volleyball national team), to inspire the global community to embrace the future of cryptocurrency. For more information, users can visit: Website | Twitter | Telegram | LinkedIn | Discord | Bitget Wallet For media inquiries, users can contact: media@bitget.com Risk Warning: Digital asset prices are subject to fluctuation and may experience significant volatility. title: Bitcoin Exchange Binance Announced That It Delisted 5 Altcoin Trading Pairs From Spot Trading! Here Are Those Altcoins
body: Leading global cryptocurrency exchange Binance has announced the removal of several spot trading pairs as part of routine market quality reviews.
